p: Mast cells contain a large amount of cytoplasmic granules, which activation caused the process of degranulation ( Zeng et al., 2016). The release of β-hexosaminidase can be used to quantify the extent of degranulation ( Huang et al., 2015). Pre-treatment with ZCO significantly suppressed the degranulation either in IgE-antigen complex or PMA/A23187-stimulated RBL-2H3 cells. In addition, ZCO treatment reduced the degranulation in RBL-2H3 cells in a dose-dependent manner, and ZCO at the concentration of 0.01% in the PMA/A23187- stimulated RBL-2H3 cells showed the similar inhibition of β-hexosaminidase release to the positive control quercetin, with an IC 50 value of 0.0066%, which indicated that ZCO may be a promising new anti-allergic agent (Figure 2).
